text:
hey, I don't know if here is anyone use `emacs-jupyter`,
I want to open a jupyter notebook program in browser, and edit the code in emacs,
then I execute some command in emacs, it will send the code to jupyter notebook on brower, which render the result
can you help me out?
ps: my English is very poor, sorry

text: You have to manually relaod the notebook in the browser AFAIK. It usually gives you a pop-up with "notebook changed" when it notices a discrepancy

text:
I'm not sure why you get this error, but I don't think this does what you want it to.
The `jupyter-emacs` will just give you the repl to send commands to the Jupyter kernel. There is no notebook involved

elements.text:

will just give you the repl to send commands to the Jupyter kernel. There is no notebook involved

text: Have you seen this? I think it might be interesting to you. It let's you do everything you'd want to do in a Jupyter notebook but in an org file <https://github.com/nnicandro/emacs-jupyter#org-mode-source-blocks>

elements.text: Have you seen this? I think it might be interesting to you. It let's you do everything you'd want to do in a Jupyter notebook but in an org file

text: That's the approach I use. However, if you really want a Jupyter notebook you might want to look at EIN <https://github.com/millejoh/emacs-ipython-notebook>

elements.text: That's the approach I use. However, if you really want a Jupyter notebook you might want to look at EIN
